member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState
member.summary: Implements SIP "Subscription-State" value. Defined in RFC 3265.

remarks.code: RFC 3265 Syntax: Subscription-State = substate-value *( SEMI subexp-params ) substate-value = "active" / "pending" / "terminated" / extension-substate extension-substate = token subexp-params = ("reason" EQUAL event-reason-value) / ("expires" EQUAL delta-seconds) / ("retry-after" EQUAL delta-seconds) / generic-param event-reason-value = "deactivated" / "probation" / "rejected" / "timeout" / "giveup" / "noresource" / event-reason-extension event-reason-extension = token

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState
member.summary: This class holds 'substate-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.active
member.summary: The subscription has been accepted and (in general) has been authorized.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.pending
member.summary: The subscription has been received by the notifier, but there is insufficient policy information to grant or deny the subscription yet.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.SubscriptionState.terminated
member.summary: The subscriber should consider the subscription terminated.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason
member.summary: This class holds 'event-reason-value' values.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.deactivated
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the subscriber SHOULD retry immediately with a new subscription. One primary use of such a status code is to allow migration of subscriptions between nodes. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "deactivated".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.probation
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated, but the client SHOULD retry at some later time. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.rejected
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated due to change in authorization policy. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "rejected".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.timeout
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because it was not refreshed before it expired. Clients MAY re-subscribe immediately. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "timeout".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.giveup
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the notifier could not obtain authorization in a timely fashion. If a "retry-after" parameter is also present, the client SHOULD wait at least the number of seconds specified by that parameter before attempting to re-subscribe; otherwise, the client MAY retry immediately, but will likely get put back into pending state.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SubscriptionState.EventReason.noresource
member.summary: The subscription has been terminated because the resource state which was being monitored no longer exists. Clients SHOULD NOT attempt to re-subscribe. The "retry-after" parameter has no semantics for "noresource".

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_SecMechanism
member.summary: Implements SIP "sec-mechanism" value. Defined in RFC 3329.

remarks.code: RFC 3329 Syntax: sec-mechanism = mechanism-name *(SEMI mech-parameters) mechanism-name = ( "digest" / "tls" / "ipsec-ike" / "ipsec-man" / token ) mech-parameters = ( preference / digest-algorithm / digest-qop / digest-verify / extension ) preference = "q" EQUAL qvalue qvalue = ( "0" [ "." 0*3DIGIT ] ) / ( "1" [ "." 0*3("0") ] ) digest-algorithm = "d-alg" EQUAL token digest-qop = "d-qop" EQUAL token digest-verify = "d-ver" EQUAL LDQUOT 32LHEX RDQUOT extension = generic-param

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType
member.summary: Proccess directives. Defined in rfc 3841 9.1.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Proxy
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to proxy request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Redirect
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each server to redirect request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Cancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoCancel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would NOT want each proxy server to send a CANCEL request to forked branches.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Fork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should fork a request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoFork
member.summary: This type of directive indicates whether a proxy should proxy to only a single address. The server SHOULD proxy the request to the "best" address (generally the one with the highest q-value).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Recurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should send requests to the addresses listed in the response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoRecurse
member.summary: This directive indicates whether a proxy server receiving a 3xx response should forward the list of addresses upstream towards the caller.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Parallel
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to proxy the request to all known addresses at once.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Sequential
member.summary: This directive indicates whether the caller would like the proxy server to go through all known addresses sequentially, contacting the next address only after it has received a non-2xx or non-6xx final response for the previous one.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.Queue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller wants to have its call queued.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Directive.DirectiveType.NoQueue
member.summary: This directive indicates whether if the called party is temporarily unreachable, caller don't want its call to be queued.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.AddressList
member.summary:
Rfc 2822 3.4 address-list. Rfc defines two types of addresses mailbox and group.
address-list syntax: address *("," address).
address syntax: mailbox / group.
mailbox syntax: ['"'dispaly-name'"' ]<localpart@domain>.
group syntax: '"'dispaly-name'":' [mailbox *(',' mailbox)]';'.

member.summary: Gets message header.

member.summary: Gets header as RFC 2822 message headers.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ParentEntity
member.summary: Gets parent entity of this entity. If this entity is top level, then this property returns null.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ChildEntities
member.summary: Gets child entities. This property is available only if ContentType = multipart/... .

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.MimeVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Mime-Version:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Type:" value. This property specifies what entity data is. NOTE: ContentType can't be changed while there is data specified(Exception is thrown) in this mime entity, because it isn't possible todo data conversion between different types. For example text/xx has charset parameter and other types don't, changing loses it and text data becomes useless.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentTypeString
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Type:" value. Returns null if value isn't set. This property specifies what entity data is. This property is meant for advanced users, who needs other values what defined MediaType_enum provides. Example value: text/plain; charset="utf-8". NOTE: ContentType can't be changed while there is data specified(Exception is thrown) in this mime entity, because it isn't possible todo data conversion between different types. For example text/xx has charset parameter and other types don't, changing loses it and text data becomes useless.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentTransferEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" value. This property specifies how data is encoded/decoded. If you set this value, it's recommended that you use QuotedPrintable for text and Base64 for binary data. 7bit,_8bit,Binary are today obsolete (used for parsing).

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Disposition:" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-Description:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentID
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Content-ID:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_Name
member.summary:
Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "name" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "name" parameter isn't set.
Note: Content-Type must be application/xxx or exception is thrown. This property is obsolete today, it's replaced with Content-Disposition: filename parameter. If possible always set FileName property instead of it.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_CharSet
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "charset" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "charset" parameter isn't set. If you don't know what charset to use then utf-8 is recommended, most of times this is sufficient. Note: Content-Type must be text/xxx or exception is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentType_Boundary
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Type:" header field "boundary" parameter. Returns null if Content-Type: header field value isn't set or Content-Type: header field "boundary" parameter isn't set. Note: Content-Type must be multipart/xxx or exception is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ContentDisposition_FileName
member.summary: Gets or sets "Content-Disposition:" header field "filename" parameter. Returns null if Content-Disposition: header field value isn't set or Content-Disposition: header field "filename" parameter isn't set. Note: Content-Disposition must be attachment or inline.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Date:" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.MessageID
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Message-ID:" value. Returns null if value isn't set. Syntax: '<'id-left@id-right'>'. Example: <621bs724bfs8@jnfsjaas4263>

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.To
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Cc
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Cc:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Bcc
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Bcc:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.From
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "From:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Sender
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Sender:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.ReplyTo
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Reply-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.InReplyTo
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "In-Reply-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DSN
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Disposition-Notification-To:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Subject
member.summary: Gets or sets header field "Subject:" value. Returns null if value isn't set.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets entity data. Data is encoded/decoded with "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" header field value. Note: This property can be set only if Content-Type: isn't multipart.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DataText
member.summary: Gets or sets entity text data. Data is encoded/decoded with "Content-Transfer-Encoding:" header field value with this.Charset charset. Note: This property is available only if ContentType is Text/xxx... or no content type specified, othwerwise Excpetion is thrown.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.MimeEntity.DataEncoded
member.summary: Gets or sets entity encoded data. If you set this value, be sure that you encode this value as specified by Content-Transfer-Encoding: header field. Set this value only if you need custom Content-Transfer-Encoding: what current Mime class won't support, other wise set data through this.Data property. Note: This property can be set only if Content-Type: isn't multipart.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.RTP.RTP_Packet
member.summary: A data packet consisting of the fixed RTP header, a possibly empty list of contributing sources (see below), and the payload data. Some underlying protocols may require an encapsulation of the RTP packet to be defined. Typically one packet of the underlying protocol contains a single RTP packet, but several RTP packets MAY be contained if permitted by the encapsulation method (see Section 11).

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri
member.summary: Implements SIP-URI. Defined in 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: SIP-URI = "sip:" [ userinfo ] hostport uri-parameters [ headers ] SIPS-URI = "sips:" [ userinfo ] hostport uri-parameters [ headers ] userinfo = ( user / telephone-subscriber ) [ ":" password ] "@") hostport = host [ ":" port ] host = hostname / IPv4address / IPv6reference

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.summary: Returns the hash code.

member.summary: Parses SIP_Uri from SIP-URI string.

Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.summary: Converts SIP_Uri to valid SIP-URI string.

member.summary: Gets or sets if secure SIP. If true then sips: uri, otherwise sip: uri.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Address
member.summary: Gets address from SIP URI. Examples: ivar@lumisoft.ee,ivar@195.222.10.1.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.User
member.summary: Gets or sets user name. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Host
member.summary: Gets or sets host name or IP.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets host port. Value -1 means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.HostPort
member.summary: Gets host with optional port. If port specified returns Host:Port, otherwise Host.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Parameters
member.summary: Gets URI parameters.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Cause
member.summary: Gets or sets 'cause' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Cause is a URI parameter that is used to indicate the service that the User Agent Server (UAS) receiving the message should perform. Defined in RFC 4458.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Comp
member.summary: Gets or sets 'comp' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3486.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets 'content-type' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Delay
member.summary: Gets or sets 'delay' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies a delay interval between announcement repetitions. The delay is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets 'duration' prameter value. Value -1 means not specified. Specifies the maximum duration of the announcement. The media server will discontinue the announcement and end the call if the maximum duration has been reached. The duration is measured in milliseconds. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Locale
member.summary: Gets or sets 'locale' prameter value. Specifies the language and optionally country variant of the announcement sequence named in the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Lr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'lr' parameter. The lr parameter, when present, indicates that the element responsible for this resource implements the routing mechanisms specified in this document. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Maddr
member.summary: Gets or sets 'maddr' parameter value. Value null means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The maddr parameter indicates the server address to be contacted for this user, overriding any address derived from the host field. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Method
member.summary: Gets or sets 'method' prameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Play
member.summary: Gets or sets 'play' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Specifies the resource or announcement sequence to be played. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Repeat
member.summary: Gets or sets 'repeat' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified, value int.MaxValue means 'forever'. Specifies how many times the media server should repeat the announcement or sequence named by the "play=" parameter. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Target
member.summary: Gets or sets 'target' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Transport
member.summary: Gets or sets 'transport' parameter value. Value null means not specified. The transport parameter determines the transport mechanism to be used for sending SIP messages. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Ttl
member.summary: Gets or sets 'ttl' parameter value. Value -1 means not specified. NOTE: This value is deprecated in since SIP 2.0. The ttl parameter determines the time-to-live value of the UDP multicast packet and MUST only be used if maddr is a multicast address and the transport protocol is UDP. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_User
member.summary: Gets or sets 'user' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.SIP_Uri.Param_Voicexml
member.summary: Gets or sets 'voicexml' parameter value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4240.

member.summary: Gets or sets header.

member.summary: Is raised when there is transport error.
member.remarks: TU(transaction user) MUST treat it as if a 503 (Service Unavailable) status code has been received (more info RFC 3261 8.1.3.).

member.name: E:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Transaction.TransactionError
member.summary: Is raised when there is transaction error. For example this is raised when server transaction never gets ACK.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyMode
member.summary:
Specifies SIP proxy mode.
All flags may be combined, except Stateless,Statefull,B2BUA. For example: (Stateless | Statefull) not allowed, but (Registrar | Presence | Statefull) is allowed.

member.summary: Proxy runs in stateless mode.

member.summary: Proxy runs in statefull mode.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyMode.B2BUA
member.summary: Proxy runs in B2BUA(back to back user agent) mode.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ClientTransaction
member.summary: A SIP_Transaction represents SIP client transaction. Defined in RFC 3261 17.1 Client Transaction. A transaction is a sequence of SIP messages exchanged between SIP network elements. Client transaction is created by UAC,UAS or proxy core. Client transaction is responsible for sending request to remote UA and processing remote UA server transaction responses. Client transaction causes remote UA to create corresponding server transaction.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ClientTransaction.#ctor(LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack,LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Request,LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Target,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: SIP request to what caused to create client transaction.
Specified if transaction adds new Via: header. If this value is false, then its user responsibility to add valid Via: header to request argument.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ClientTransaction.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes transaction and cleans up all resources.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ClientTransaction.Begin
member.summary: Call this method to start transaction.
member.exception: Is called when Begin is called multiple times.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ClientTransaction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels transaction.
member.remarks:
Cancel behaviour: *) If non-INVITE method, skip cancel. *) If has got final response, skip cancel because there is nothing to cancel. *) If transaction has got provisional response, send cancel. *) If transaction hasn't got provisional response, queue cancel request. If provisional response received, send cancel. If final response received, skip cancel because there is nothing to cancel.
NOTE: Canceled event is raised only if '478 Request Terminated' is received from calee !

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext
member.summary: Implements SIP 'proxy context'. Defined in RFC 3261.
member.remarks: Proxy context is bridge between caller and calee. Proxy context job is to forward request to contact(s) and send received responses back to caller.

member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: Server transaction what is used to send SIP responses back to caller.
Specifies how proxy context must handle forking.
Specifies if prxy context is in B2BUA or just transaction satefull mode.
Specifies if proxy should not send Cancel to forked requests.
Specifies what proxy server does when it gets 3xx response. If true proxy will forward request to new specified address if false, proxy will return 3xx response to caller.
Possible remote targets. NOTE: These values must be in priority order !
member.exception: Is raised when any of the reference type prameters is null.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up any resources being used.

member.summary: Is called when server transaction has canceled.

member.summary: Is called when server transaction has completed and terminated.

member.summary: Is called when client transactions receives response.

member.summary: Is called when client transaction has timed out.

member.summary: Is called when client transaction encountered transport error.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext.ClientTransaction_Terminated(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Is called when client transaction has terminated.

member.summary: Starts processing.
member.exception: Is raised when this method is called more than once.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_ProxyContext.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels proxy context processing. All client transactions and owner server transaction will be canceled, proxy context will be disposed.

member.summary: Creates client transaction and starts processing it.

member.summary: Creates client transaction and starts processing it.

member.summary: Processes client transaction received response.
member.param: Client transaction what response it is.

member.param: Client transaction what response it is.

member.summary: Gets best final response. If no final response in responses collection, null is returned.

member.summary: Gets time when proxy context was created.

member.summary: Gets forking mode used by this 'proxy context'.

member.summary: Gets if proxy cancels forked requests what are not needed any more. If true, requests not canceled, otherwise canceled.

member.summary: This enum holds SIP transaction states. Defined in RFC 3261.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Calling
member.summary: Calling to recipient. This is used only by INVITE client transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Trying
member.summary: This is transaction initial state. Used only in Non-INVITE transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Proceeding
member.summary: This is INVITE server transaction initial state. Used only in INVITE server transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Completed
member.summary: Transaction has got final response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Confirmed
member.summary: Transation has got ACK from request maker. This is used only by INVITE server transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_TransactionState.Terminated
member.summary: Transaction has terminated and waits disposing.

member.exception: Raised when reader is null.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ViaParm
member.summary: Implements SIP "via-parm" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code:
RFC 3261 Syntax: via-parm = sent-protocol LWS sent-by *( SEMI via-params ) via-params = via-ttl / via-maddr / via-received / via-branch / via-extension via-ttl = "ttl" EQUAL ttl via-maddr = "maddr" EQUAL host via-received = "received" EQUAL (IPv4address / IPv6address) via-branch = "branch" EQUAL token via-extension = generic-param sent-protocol = protocol-name SLASH protocol-version SLASH transport protocol-name = "SIP" / token protocol-version = token transport = "UDP" / "TCP" / "TLS" / "SCTP" / other-transport sent-by = host [ COLON port ] ttl = 1*3DIGIT ; 0 to 255
Via extentions: // RFC 3486 via-compression = "comp" EQUAL ("sigcomp" / other-compression) // RFC 3581 response-port = "rport" [EQUAL 1*DIGIT]

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes
member.summary: This class holds SIP respnse codes.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x100_Trying
member.summary: This response indicates that the request has been received by the next-hop server and that some unspecified action is being taken on behalf of this call (for example, a database is being consulted).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x180_Ringing
member.summary: The UA receiving the INVITE is trying to alert the user.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x181_Call_Forwarded
member.summary: A server MAY use this status code to indicate that the call is being forwarded to a different set of destinations.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x182_Queued
member.summary: The called party is temporarily unavailable, but the server has decided to queue the call rather than reject it. When the callee becomes available, it will return the appropriate final status response.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x183_Session_Progress
member.summary: The 183 (Session Progress) response is used to convey information about the progress of the call that is not otherwise classified.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x200_Ok
member.summary: The request has succeeded.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x202_Ok
member.summary: The request has accepted. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x400_Bad_Request
member.summary: The request could not be understood due to malformed syntax. The Reason-Phrase SHOULD identify the syntax problem in more detail, for example, "Missing Call-ID header field".

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x401_Unauthorized
member.summary: The request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x403_Forbidden
member.summary: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Authorization will not help, and the request SHOULD NOT be repeated.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x404_Not_Found
member.summary: The server has definitive information that the user does not exist at the domain specified in the Request-URI.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x405_Method_Not_Allowed
member.summary: The method specified in the Request-Line is understood, but not allowed for the address identified by the Request-URI.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x406_Not_Acceptable
member.summary: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities that have content characteristics not acceptable according to the Accept header field sent in the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x407_Proxy_Authentication_Required
member.summary: This code is similar to 401 (Unauthorized), but indicates that the client MUST first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x408_Request_Timeout
member.summary: The server could not produce a response within a suitable amount of time, for example, if it could not determine the location of the user in time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x410_Gone
member.summary: The requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known. This condition is expected to be considered permanent.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x412_Conditional_Request_Failed
member.summary: Is used to indicate that the precondition given for the request has failed. Defined in rfc 3903.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x413_Request_Entity_Too_Large
member.summary: The server is refusing to process a request because the request entity-body is larger than the server is willing or able to process. The server MAY close the connection to prevent the client from continuing the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x414_RequestURI_Too_Long
member.summary: The server is refusing to service the request because the Request-URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x415_Unsupported_Media_Type
member.summary: The server is refusing to service the request because the message body of the request is in a format not supported by the server for the requested method. The server MUST return a list of acceptable formats using the Accept, Accept-Encoding, or Accept-Language header field, depending on the specific problem with the content.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x416_Unsupported_URI_Scheme
member.summary: The server cannot process the request because the scheme of the URI in the Request-URI is unknown to the server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x417_Unknown_Resource_Priority
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 4412.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x420_Bad_Extension
member.summary: The server did not understand the protocol extension specified in a Proxy-Require or Require header field.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x421_Extension_Required
member.summary: The UAS needs a particular extension to process the request, but this extension is not listed in a Supported header field in the request. Responses with this status code MUST contain a Require header field listing the required extensions.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x422_Session_Interval_Too_Small
member.summary: It is generated by a UAS or proxy when a request contains a Session-Expires header field with a duration below the minimum timer for the server. The 422 response MUST contain a Min-SE header field with the minimum timer for that server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x423_Interval_Too_Brief
member.summary: The server is rejecting the request because the expiration time of the resource refreshed by the request is too short. This response can be used by a registrar to reject a registration whose Contact header field expiration time was too small.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x428_Use_Identity_Header
member.summary: It is used when the verifier receives a message with an Identity signature that does not correspond to the digest-string calculated by the verifier. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x429_Provide_Referrer_Identity
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 3892.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x436_Bad_Identity_Info
member.summary: It is used when the Identity-Info header contains a URI that cannot be dereferenced by the verifier (either the URI scheme is unsupported by the verifier, or the resource designated by the URI is otherwise unavailable). Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x437_Unsupported_Certificate
member.summary: It is used when the verifier cannot validate the certificate referenced by the URI of the Identity-Info header, because, for example, the certificate is self-signed, or signed by a root certificate authority for whom the verifier does not possess a root certificate. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x438_Invalid_Identity_Header
member.summary: It is used when the verifier receives a message with an Identity signature that does not correspond to the digest-string calculated by the verifier. Defined in rfc 4474.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x480_Temporarily_Unavailable
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is currently unavailable (for example, is not logged in, logged in but in a state that precludes communication with the callee, or has activated the "do not disturb" feature).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x481_Call_Transaction_Does_Not_Exist
member.summary: This status indicates that the UAS received a request that does not match any existing dialog or transaction.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x482_Loop_Detected
member.summary: The server has detected a loop.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x483_Too_Many_Hops
member.summary: The server received a request that contains a Max-Forwards.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x484_Address_Incomplete
member.summary: The server received a request with a Request-URI that was incomplete. Additional information SHOULD be provided in the reason phrase.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x485_Ambiguous
member.summary: The Request-URI was ambiguous.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x486_Busy_Here
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully, but the callee is currently not willing or able to take additional calls at this end system. The response MAY indicate a better time to call in the Retry-After header field.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x487_Request_Terminated
member.summary: The request was terminated by a BYE or CANCEL request. This response is never returned for a CANCEL request itself.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x488_Not_Acceptable_Here
member.summary: The response has the same meaning as 606 (Not Acceptable), but only applies to the specific resource addressed by the Request-URI and the request may succeed elsewhere.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x489_Bad_Event
member.summary: Is used to indicate that the server did not understand the event package specified in a "Event" header field. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x491_Request_Pending
member.summary: The request was received by a UAS that had a pending request within the same dialog.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x493_Undecipherable
member.summary: The request was received by a UAS that contained an encrypted MIME body for which the recipient does not possess or will not provide an appropriate decryption key.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x494_Security_Agreement_Required
member.summary: TODO: add description. Defined in rfc 3329.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x500_Server_Internal_Error
member.summary: The server encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x501_Not_Implemented
member.summary: The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x502_Bad_Gateway
member.summary: The server, while acting as a gateway or proxy, received an invalid response from the downstream server it accessed in attempting to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x503_Service_Unavailable
member.summary: The server is temporarily unable to process the request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x504_Timeout
member.summary: The server did not receive a timely response from an external server it accessed in attempting to process the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x504_Version_Not_Supported
member.summary: The server does not support, or refuses to support, the SIP protocol version that was used in the request.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x513_Message_Too_Large
member.summary: The server was unable to process the request since the message length exceeded its capabilities.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x580_Precondition_Failure
member.summary: When a UAS, acting as an answerer, cannot or is not willing to meet the preconditions in the offer. Defined in rfc 3312.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x600_Busy_Everywhere
member.summary: The callee's end system was contacted successfully but the callee is busy and does not wish to take the call at this time.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x603_Decline
member.summary: The callee's machine was successfully contacted but the user explicitly does not wish to or cannot participate.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x604_Does_Not_Exist_Anywhere
member.summary: The server has authoritative information that the user indicated in the Request-URI does not exist anywhere

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ResponseCodes.x606_Not_Acceptable
member.summary: The user's agent was contacted successfully but some aspects of the session description such as the requested media, bandwidth, or addressing style were not acceptable.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_RegistrationContact
member.summary: Implements SIP registration contact.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Proxy.SIP_RegistrationContact.#ctor(LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ContactParam,System.Int32,LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_EndPointInfo)

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6. Content-Transfer-Encoding. Specified how entity data is encoded.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._7bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.7. 7bit data. "7bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]. No octets with decimal values greater than 127 are allowed and neither are NULs (octets with decimal value 0). CR (decimal value 13) and LF (decimal value 10) octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum._8bit
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.8. 8bit data. "8bit data" refers to data that is all represented as relatively short lines with 998 octets or less between CRLF line separation sequences [RFC-821]), but octets with decimal values greater than 127 may be used. As with "7bit data" CR and LF octets only occur as part of CRLF line separation sequences and no NULs are allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Binary
member.summary: Rfc 2045 2.9. Binary data. "Binary data" refers to data where any sequence of octets whatsoever is allowed.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.QuotedPrintable
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.7 Quoted-Printable Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Base64
member.summary: Rfc 2045 6.8 Base64 Content-Transfer-Encoding.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.NotSpecified
member.summary: Content-Transfer-Encoding field isn't available(doesn't exist).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentTransferEncoding_enum.Unknown
member.summary: Content transfer encoding is unknown.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentDisposition_enum

member.summary: Content is attachment.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.ContentDisposition_enum.Unknown
member.summary: Content is unknown.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.IMAP.IMAP_SequenceSet
member.summary:
IMAP sequence-set. RFC 3501.
Examples: 2 -> seq-number (2) 2:4 -> seq-range (from 2 - 4) 2:* -> seq-range (from 2 to last) 2,3,10:* -> sequence-set (seq-number,seq-number,seq-range) (2,3, 10 - last)
NOTES: *) comma separates sequence parts *) * means maximum value.

member.summary: Gets Accept-Resource-Priority headers. Defined in RFC 4412.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AlertInfo
member.summary: Gets AlertInfo values collection. When present in an INVITE request, the Alert-Info header field specifies an alternative ring tone to the UAS. When present in a 180 (Ringing) response, the Alert-Info header field specifies an alternative ringback tone to the UAC.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Allow
member.summary: Gets methods collection which is supported by the UA which generated the message.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AllowEvents
member.summary: Gets Allow-Events header which indicates the event packages supported by the client. Defined in rfc 3265.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.AuthenticationInfo
member.summary: Gets the Authentication-Info header fields which provides for mutual authentication with HTTP Digest.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Authorization
member.summary: Gets the Authorization header fields which contains authentication credentials of a UA.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CallID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Call-ID header field which uniquely identifies a particular invitation or all registrations of a particular client. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CallInfo
member.summary: Gets the Call-Info header field which provides additional information about the caller or callee, depending on whether it is found in a request or response.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.Contact
member.summary: Gets contact header fields. The Contact header field provides a SIP or SIPS URI that can be used to contact that specific instance of the UA for subsequent requests.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentDisposition
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content-Disposition header field which describes how the message body or, for multipart messages, a message body part is to be interpreted by the UAC or UAS. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentEncoding
member.summary: Gets the Content-Encodings which is used as a modifier to the "media-type". When present, its value indicates what additional content codings have been applied to the entity-body, and thus what decoding mechanisms MUST be applied in order to obtain the media-type referenced by the Content-Type header field.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentLanguage
member.summary: Gets content languages.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content-Type header field which indicates the media type of the message-body sent to the recipient. Value null means not specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_Message.CSeq
member.summary: Gets or sets command sequence number and the request method. Value null means not specified.

member.summary: Gets or sets date and time. Value DateTime.MinValue means that value not specified.

member.summary: Gets History-Info headers. Defined in RFC 4244.

member.summary: Identity header value. Value null means not specified. Defined in RFC 4474.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter
member.summary: Implements SIP "Retry-After" value. Defined in rfc 3261. Retry after specifies how many seconds the service is expected to be unavailable to the requesting client.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: Retry-After = delta-seconds [ comment ] *( SEMI retry-param ) retry-param = ("duration" EQUAL delta-seconds) / generic-param

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses "Retry-After" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when value is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.Parse(LumiSoft.Net.StringReader)
member.summary: Parses "Retry-After" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.ToStringValue
member.summary: Converts this to valid "Retry-After" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets how many seconds the service is expected to be unavailable to the requesting client.
member.exception: Is raised when when value less than 1 is passed.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_RetryAfter.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets 'duration' parameter value. The 'duration' parameter indicates how long the called party will be reachable starting at the initial time of availability. If no duration parameter is given, the service is assumed to be available indefinitely. Value -1 means not specified.
member.exception: Is raised when when value less than 1 is passed.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: warning-value = warn-code SP warn-agent SP warn-text warn-code = 3DIGIT warn-agent = hostport / pseudonym ; the name or pseudonym of the server adding ; the Warning header, for use in debugging warn-text = quoted-string pseudonym = token

member.summary: Parses "warning-value" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.summary: Parses "warning-value" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_WarningValue.ToStringValue
member.summary: Converts this to valid "warning-value" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_WarningValue.Code
member.summary: Gets or sets warning code.

member.summary: Gets or sets warning text.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language
member.summary: Implements SIP "language" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: language = language-range *(SEMI accept-param) language-range = ( ( 1*8ALPHA *( "-" 1*8ALPHA ) ) / "*" ) accept-param = ("q" EQUAL qvalue) / generic-param

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Parses "language" from specified value.
member.exception: Raised when value is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.Parse(LumiSoft.Net.StringReader)
member.summary: Parses "language" from specified reader.
member.exception: Raised when reader is null.
Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.ToStringValue
member.summary: Converts this to valid "language" value.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.LanguageRange
member.summary: Gets or sets language range. Value *(STAR) means all languages.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_Language.QValue
member.summary: Gets or sets qvalue parameter. Targets are processed from highest qvalue to lowest. This value must be between 0.0 and 1.0. Value -1 means that value not specified.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_ContentDisposition
member.summary: Implements SIP "Content-Disposition" value. Defined in RFC 3261.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: Content-Disposition = disp-type *( SEMI disp-param ) disp-type = "render" / "session" / "icon" / "alert" / disp-extension-token disp-param = handling-param / generic-param handling-param = "handling" EQUAL ( "optional" / "required" / other-handling ) other-handling = token disp-extension-token = token

member.summary: Creates valid nonce value.

member.summary: Creates valid opaque value.

member.summary: Gets or sets request method.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Realm
member.summary: Gets or sets a string to be displayed to users so they know which username and password to use. This string should contain at least the name of the host performing the authentication and might additionally indicate the collection of users who might have access. An example might be "registered_users@gotham.news.com".

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Nonce
member.summary: Gets or sets a server-specified unique data string. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data. Suggested value: base64(time-stamp hex(time-stamp ":" ETag ":" private-key)).
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Opaque
member.summary: Gets or sets string of data, specified by the server, which should be returned by the client unchanged. It is recommended that this string be base64 or hexadecimal data.
member.exception: Is raised when invalid value is specified.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Algorithm
member.summary: Gets or sets algorithm to use to produce the digest and a checksum. This is normally MD5 or MD5-sess.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Response
member.summary: Gets a string of 32 hex digits computed by HTTP digest algorithm, which proves that the user knows a password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.UserName
member.summary: Gets or sets user name.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets password.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Uri
member.summary: Gets the URI from Request-URI.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.Qop
member.summary: Gets or sets value what indicates "quality of protection" the client has applied to the message. If present, its value MUST be one of the alternatives the server indicated it supports in the WWW-Authenticate header. This directive is optional in order to preserve backward compatibility.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.CNonce
member.summary: Gets or sets Client nonce value. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field.

member.name: P:LumiSoft.Net.AUTH.Auth_HttpDigest.NonceCount
member.summary: Gets nonce count. This MUST be specified if a qop directive is sent (see above), and MUST NOT be specified if the server did not send a qop directive in the WWW-Authenticate header field. The nc-value is the hexadecimal count of the number of requests.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType
member.summary: Specifies UDP network type.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.UdpBlocked
member.summary: UDP is always blocked.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.OpenInternet
member.summary: No NAT, public IP, no firewall.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.SymmetricUdpFirewall
member.summary: No NAT, public IP, but symmetric UDP firewall.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.FullCone
member.summary: A full cone NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port are mapped to the same external IP address and port. Furthermore, any external host can send a packet to the internal host, by sending a packet to the mapped external address.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.RestrictedCone
member.summary: A restricted cone NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port are mapped to the same external IP address and port. Unlike a full cone NAT, an external host (with IP address X) can send a packet to the internal host only if the internal host had previously sent a packet to IP address X.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.PortRestrictedCone
member.summary: A port restricted cone NAT is like a restricted cone NAT, but the restriction includes port numbers. Specifically, an external host can send a packet, with source IP address X and source port P, to the internal host only if the internal host had previously sent a packet to IP address X and port P.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.STUN.Client.STUN_NetType.Symmetric
member.summary: A symmetric NAT is one where all requests from the same internal IP address and port, to a specific destination IP address and port, are mapped to the same external IP address and port. If the same host sends a packet with the same source address and port, but to a different destination, a different mapping is used. Furthermore, only the external host that receives a packet can send a UDP packet back to the internal host.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x300_Incompatible_network_protocol
member.summary: One or more network protocols contained in the session description are not available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x301_Incompatible_network_address_formats
member.summary: One or more network address formats contained in the session description are not available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x302_Incompatible_network_address_formats
member.summary: One or more transport protocols described in the session description are not available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x303_Incompatible_bandwidth_units
member.summary: One or more bandwidth measurement units contained in the session description were not understood.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x304_Media_type_not_available
member.summary: One or more media types contained in the session description are not available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x305_Incompatible_media_format
member.summary: One or more media formats contained in the session description are not available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x306_Attribute_not_understood
member.summary: One or more of the media attributes in the session description are not supported.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x307_Session_description_parameter_not_understood
member.summary: A parameter other than those listed above was not understood.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x330_Multicast_not_available
member.summary: The site where the user is located does not support multicast.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x331_Unicast_not_available
member.summary: The site where the user is located does not support unicast communication (usually due to the presence of a firewall).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x370_Insufficient_bandwidth
member.summary: The bandwidth specified in the session description or defined by the media exceeds that known to be available.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_WarningCodes.x399_Miscellaneous_warning
member.summary: The warning text can include arbitrary information to be presented to a human user or logged. A system receiving this warning MUST NOT take any automated action.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_TargetDialog
member.summary: Implements SIP "Target-Dialog" value. Defined in RFC 4538.

remarks.code: RFC 4538 Syntax: Target-Dialog = callid *(SEMI td-param) ;callid from RFC 3261 td-param = remote-param / local-param / generic-param remote-param = "remote-tag" EQUAL token local-param = "local-tag" EQUAL token

Raised when invalid SIP message.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_t_CSeq
member.summary: Implements SIP "Cseq" value. Defined in RFC 3261. A CSeq in a request contains a single decimal sequence number and the request method. The method part of CSeq is case-sensitive. The CSeq header field serves to order transactions within a dialog, to provide a means to uniquely identify transactions, and to differentiate between new requests and request retransmissions.

remarks.code: RFC 3261 Syntax: CSeq = 1*DIGIT LWS Method

Raised when invalid SIP message.

Parses bracket parameter from args text. Parameter may be not between (), then then args text is considered as value. Example: (test test);test test.
This method also removes parsed parameter from argsText.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags
member.summary: SIP Option Tags. Defined in RFC 3261 27.1, defined values are in: http://www.iana.org/assignments/sip-parameters.
member.remarks: Option tags are used in header fields such as Require, Supported, Proxy-Require, and Unsupported in support of SIP compatibility mechanisms for extensions (Section 19.2). The option tag itself is a string that is associated with a particular SIP option (that is, an extension).

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.x100rel
member.summary: This option tag is for reliability of provisional responses. When present in a Supported header, it indicates that the UA can send or receive reliable provisional responses. When present in a Require header in a request it indicates that the UAS MUST send all provisional responses reliably. When present in a Require header in a reliable provisional response, it indicates that the response is to be sent reliably. Defined in rfc 3262.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.early_session
member.summary: A UA adding the early-session option tag to a message indicates that it understands the early-session content disposition. Defined in rfc 3959.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.eventlist
member.summary: Extension to allow subscriptions to lists of resources. Defined in rfc 4662.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.histinfo
member.summary: When used with the Supported header, this option tag indicates support for the History Information to be captured for requests and returned in subsequent responses. This tag is not used in a Proxy-Require or Require header field since support of History-Info is optional. Defined in rfc 4244.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.join
member.summary: Support for the SIP Join Header. Defined in rfc 3911.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.norefersub
member.summary: This option tag specifies a User Agent ability of accepting a REFER request without establishing an implicit subscription (compared to the default case defined in RFC3515). Defined in rfc 3911.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.path
member.summary: A SIP UA that supports the Path extension header field includes this option tag as a header field value in a Supported header field in all requests generated by that UA. Intermediate proxies may use the presence of this option tag in a REGISTER request to determine whether to offer Path service for for that request. If an intermediate proxy requires that the registrar support Path for a request, then it includes this option tag as a header field value in a Requires header field in that request. Defined in rfc 3327.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.precondition
member.summary: An offerer MUST include this tag in the Require header field if the offer contains one or more "mandatory" strength-tags. If all the strength-tags in the description are "optional" or "none" the offerer MUST include this tag either in a Supported header field or in a Require header field. Defined in rfc 3312.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.pref
member.summary: This option tag is used to ensure that a server understands the callee capabilities parameters used in the request. Defined in rfc 3840.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.privacy
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the Privacy mechanism. When used in the Proxy-Require header, it indicates that proxy servers do not forward the request unless they can provide the requested privacy service. This tag is not used in the Require or Supported headers. Proxies remove this option tag before forwarding the request if the desired privacy function has been performed. Defined in rfc 3323.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.replaces
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the SIP Replaces header. Defined in rfc 3891.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.resource_priority
member.summary: Indicates or requests support for the resource priority mechanism. Defined in rfc 4412.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.sdp_anat
member.summary: The option-tag sdp-anat is defined for use in the Require and Supported SIP [RFC3261] header fields. SIP user agents that place this option-tag in a Supported header field understand the ANAT semantics as defined in [RFC4091]. Defined in rfc 4092.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.sec_agree
member.summary: This option tag indicates support for the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Require, or Proxy-Require headers, it indicates that proxy servers are required to use the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Supported header, it indicates that the User Agent Client supports the Security Agreement mechanism. When used in the Require header in the 494 (Security Agreement Required) or 421 (Extension Required) responses, it indicates that the User Agent Client must use the Security Agreement Mechanism. Defined in rfc 3329.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.tdialog
member.summary: This option tag is used to identify the target dialog header field extension. When used in a Require header field, it implies that the recipient needs to support the Target-Dialog header field. When used in a Supported header field, it implies that the sender of the message supports it. Defined in rfc 4538.

member.name: F:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Message.SIP_OptionTags.timer
member.summary: This option tag is for support of the session timer extension. Inclusion in a Supported header field in a request or response indicates that the UA is capable of performing refreshes according to that specification. Inclusion in a Require header in a request means that the UAS must understand the session timer extension to process the request. Inclusion in a Require header field in a response indicates that the UAC must look for the Session-Expires header field in the response, and process accordingly. Defined in rfc 4028.

member.summary: Reads specified length of data from socket and store to specified stream.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SocketEx.ReadPeriodTerminated(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads period terminated string. The data is terminated by a line containing only a period, that is, the character sequence "<CRLF>.<CRLF>". When a line of text is received, it checks the line. If the line is composed of a single period, it is treated as the end of data indicator. If the first character is a period and there are other characters on the line, the first character is deleted. If maximum allowed data length is exceeded data is read to end, but isn't stored to buffer and exception is thrown after data reading.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SocketEx.ReadPeriodTerminated(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads period terminated data. The data is terminated by a line containing only a period, that is, the character sequence "<CRLF>.<CRLF>". When a line of text is received, it checks the line. If the line is composed of a single period, it is treated as the end of data indicator. If the first character is a period and there are other characters on the line, the first character is deleted. If maximum allowed data length is exceeded data is read to end, but isn't stored to stream and exception is thrown after data reading.
member.param: Stream where to store readed data.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SocketEx.BeginReadPeriodTerminated(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,System.Object,LumiSoft.Net.SocketCallBack)
member.summary: Begins reading period terminated data. The data is terminated by a line containing only a period, that is, the character sequence "<CRLF>.<CRLF>". When a line of text is received, it checks the line. If the line is composed of a single period, it is treated as the end of data indicator. If the first character is a period and there are other characters on the line, the first character is deleted. If maximum allowed data length is exceeded data is read to end, but isn't stored to stream and exception is thrown after data reading.
member.param: Stream where to store readed data.
The method to be called when the asynchronous read operation is completed.

member.param: The method to be called when the asynchronous period terminated read operation is completed.
Stream where to store readed data.
Specifies maximum data legth in bytes.
Last byte what was readed pevious method call or -1 if first method call.
Specifies if there is active line break.
Specifies if terminating CRLF is expected.

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction
member.summary: Implements SIP server transaction. Defined in RFC 3261 17.2 Server Transaction. A transaction is a sequence of SIP messages exchanged between SIP network elements. Server transaction is created when remote UA (client transaction) request is received by local UA. Server transaction provides way to send responses back to remote UA client transaction.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.#ctor(LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Stack,LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Request)
member.summary: Default constructor.
member.param: SIP request what caused to create server transaction.

member.summary: Disposes transaction and cleans up all resources.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.Begin
member.summary: Starts processing server transaction.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels transaction. NOTE: Only INVITE transaction can be canceled, for other methods cancel is skipped. If If final response is already sent, then cancel has no effect and will be skipped.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.SendResponse(LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Response)
member.summary: Sends a SIP response message to the caller client transaction whose request initiated this server transaction. The response value must be SIP_ServerTransaction.Request.CreateResponse value.
member.exception: Is raised when this class is Disposed and this property is accessed.
Is raised when response is null.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.SendResponse(LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_Response,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a SIP response message to the caller client transaction whose request initiated this server transaction. The response value must be SIP_ServerTransaction.Request.CreateResponse value.
member.param: Specifies if provisional response is sent reliably. This option has effect only if INVITE 101 > 199 response is sent. This value can be true only if this.CanSend100relResponse = true, otherwise InvalidOperationException is thrown.
member.exception: Is raised when this class is Disposed and this property is accessed.
Is raised when response is null.
Is raised when provisional response is tried to send reliably, but caller won't support reliable provisional responses.

member.name: M:LumiSoft.Net.SIP.Stack.SIP_ServerTransaction.LingerDispose
member.summary: Schedules dispose method. Dispose is called after 32 seconds. This is not defined in rfc, but is needed for request retransmission catches and and delayed PRACK request for INVITE unacknowledged reliable provisional responses. About INVITE server transaction there is discussion at http://bugs.sipit.net/show_bug.cgi?id=769,

member.name: T:LumiSoft.Net.Mime.Mime
member.summary: Class for creating,parsing,modifing rfc 2822 mime messages.

remarks.code:
Message examples:
Simple message:
//--- Beginning of message From: sender@domain.com To: recipient@domain.com Subject: Message subject. Content-Type: text/plain
Message body text. Bla blaa blaa,blaa. //--- End of message
In simple message MainEntity is whole message.
Message with attachments:
//--- Beginning of message From: sender@domain.com To: recipient@domain.com Subject: Message subject. Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="multipart_mixed"
--multipart_mixed /* text entity */ Content-Type: text/plain
Message body text. Bla blaa blaa,blaa. --multipart_mixed /* attachment entity */ Content-Type: application/octet-stream
attachment_data --multipart_mixed-- //--- End of message
MainEntity is multipart_mixed entity and text and attachment entities are child entities of MainEntity.
